
# Activities

## Familiarising with RStudio {data-background=#CCE5FF}

1. Open RStudio IDE.
1. Locate the `Console` and the `Environment` panes.
1. One by one, write the following command in the `Console` and press return:

    ```{r, eval=FALSE}
    a <- "banana"
    b <- list(banana_el = "banana", logic_el = TRUE, numeric_el = pi)
    c <- data.frame(fr = c("pear", "apple"), vo = c('A', 'E'), lo = c(T, F))
    d <- function(x) x * sin(x)
    ```

1. Accessing the help from the command line:

    ```{r}
    ?t.test
    ```
    
    In the `Help` pane, click <img src="data:image/png;base64," width="20" height="18"> icon to obtain general information.

## Creating and opening a project {data-background=#CCE5FF}

1. Detect were you are working:

    ```{r, eval=FALSE}
    getwd()      # GET Working Directory
    list.files() # List files in your current directory
    ```

1. By default, `Files` pane should show the current directory.
1. Press <img src="data:image/png;base64," width="16" height="16"> icon at the top-right corner and select `New Project...`
    * Create a project in a new Directory of your computer.
    * Name your project `temporal`.

1. Download the file <https://github.com/mcomas/RINTRO-01/archive/master.zip>.
1. Unzip the file in a new Directory.
1. Open the file `RINTRO-01.Rproj`.


## Executing R scripts {data-background=#CCE5FF}

1. In project `RINTRO-01-master`, open the file `01-script.R`
